result.execSummary:
The defendant Sade S Franklin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with 2 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0.
Pay DNA surcharges.
Pay court costs.
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Cash Bail to apply
- If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that she may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary. Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: The first 30 days served straight commencing 12/21/2015.  The remaining 5 months with served with Huber for work, school, and childcare.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, received and filed.

Defendant Sade S Franklin in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  PSI reviewed.  There are no corrections.    PSI reviewed and corrections made.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by:  Ben G
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS with 2 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS/MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS/MONTHS.
Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program.
Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation

  Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 6 months in the HOC the first 30 days served straight commencing 12/21/2015.  The remaining 5 months with served with Huber for work, school, and childcare.
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- 100 hours of community service
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0
Pay DNA surcharges;
Pay court costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash Bail to apply
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that she may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Sentencing Referral form
Documents on behalf of the defendant
Letters on behalf of the defendant, received and filed

Defendant Sade S Franklin in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.
Statement heard from Kelly M.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.
Bail Refund Packets

Defendant Sade S Franklin in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing.  For reasons stated on the record, defense requested an adjournment.  State did not object. Court granted defense motion for an adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 22.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sade S Franklin in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 04/14/2015 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Attorney Enku Edgar Lin, 819 North 6th Street, 9th Floor, Milwaukee, Wisconsin 53203.

Defendant Sade S Franklin in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant originally filed a signed Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver form.  Defense Counsel and defendant withdraw waiver form and request a hearing.  Case is temporarily passed.  

Case recalled on the record.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Thomas Trettin-MCSD Sergeant.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail refund check packet.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered Absolute Sobriety.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sade S Franklin in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES  QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/31/15 @ 1:30pm
